page.title: 20Interview with a Met.officer
page.content: An officer works in the{met.office forecasting the weather for the Base. Local observations are taken,but the main weather picture comes down the line from computers at Cranborne.Local average temperatures are{23c.}in summer and{6c.}in winter.Rainfall varies widely from an average of{30 {inches}a year. The prevailing{wind}is from the{south west. { Forecasts}are issued{3 times a day, for the morning, afternoon and night flights. They go up to 4 days ahead and can be obtained for any destination. Although forecasts are only for Navy use, the Met. office will answer queries from local farmers, especially at harvest time. A forecast of thunder, strong winds, hail, fog or snow will all be enough to{ground the planes}so it is important to get the weather right!
